00012 // File includes
00014 #include <malloc.h>
00015 #include <stdlib.h>
00016 #include <string.h>
00017 #include "common_defs.h"
00018 #include "user_settings.h"

00021 // File local defines
00023 #define DEF_RAW_OUTPUT_FILENAME                         "raw_values.dat"                                                
00024 #define DEF_PARSED_OUTPUT_FILENAME                      "parsed_values.dat"                                             
00026 #define MAX_FILENAME_LENGHT                                     255                                                                             
00028 #define DEF_NUM_EVENTS                                          -1                                                                              
00029 #define DEF_BASE_ADDRESS                                        0x3210                                                                  
00030 #define DEF_BOARD_TYPE_STR                                      "V1190A"                                                                
00031 #define DEF_V1190_TYPE                                          CVT_V1190_TYPE_A                                                
00032 #define DEF_TDC_COUNT                                           CVT_V1190_NUM_TDC_A                                             
00033 #define DEF_ACQUISITION_MODE                            AM_TRIGGER_MATCH                                                
00034 #define DEF_ACQUISITION_MODE_PARAMS                     "1,1,0,-1,-1,-1,-1,1,0"                                 
00036 
00037 // File local variables declaration
00039 
00041 // File local methods declaration
00043 static BOOL parse_continuous_param( const char* line, continuous_mode_param *target);
00044 static BOOL parse_trigger_matching_param( const char* line, trigger_matching_mode_param *target);

00049 
00050 /**************************************************
00051 **************************************************/
00052 BOOL user_settings_open( user_setting_data* p_data)
00053 {
00054         // module variable init
00055         p_data->m_raw_output_filename= (char*)malloc( MAX_FILENAME_LENGHT);
00056         p_data->m_parsed_output_filename= (char*)malloc( MAX_FILENAME_LENGHT);
00057 
00058         // setting default values ...
00059         if( p_data->m_raw_output_filename== NULL)
00060                 TRACE("user setting module: insufficient memory !\n");
00061         else
00062                 strcpy( p_data->m_raw_output_filename, DEF_RAW_OUTPUT_FILENAME);
00063 
00064         if( p_data->m_parsed_output_filename== NULL)
00065                 TRACE("user setting module: insufficient memory !\n");
00066         else
00067                 strcpy( p_data->m_parsed_output_filename, DEF_PARSED_OUTPUT_FILENAME);
00068 
00069         p_data->m_num_events= DEF_NUM_EVENTS;
00070         p_data->m_base_address= DEF_BASE_ADDRESS;
00071         p_data->m_V1190_type= DEF_V1190_TYPE;
00072         p_data->m_tdc_count= DEF_TDC_COUNT;
00073 
00074         p_data->m_acquisition_mode.m_mode= DEF_ACQUISITION_MODE;
00075         switch( p_data->m_acquisition_mode.m_mode)
00076         {
00077         case AM_CONTINUOUS:
00078                 parse_continuous_param( DEF_ACQUISITION_MODE_PARAMS, &p_data->m_acquisition_mode.m_params.m_continuos);
00079                 break;
00080         case AM_TRIGGER_MATCH:
00081                 parse_trigger_matching_param( DEF_ACQUISITION_MODE_PARAMS, &p_data->m_acquisition_mode.m_params.m_trigger_matching);
00082                 break;
00083         case AM_NONE:
00084                 break;
00085         }
00086         return TRUE;
00087 }
00088 /**************************************************
00089 **************************************************/
00090 BOOL user_settings_close( user_setting_data* p_data)
00091 {
00092         // module variable free
00093         if( p_data->m_raw_output_filename)
00094                 free( p_data->m_raw_output_filename);
00095         if( p_data->m_parsed_output_filename)
00096                 free( p_data->m_parsed_output_filename);
00097 
00098         // setting invalid values ...
00099         p_data->m_raw_output_filename= NULL;
00100         p_data->m_parsed_output_filename= NULL;
00101 
00102         return TRUE;
00103 }
00104 
00105 /**************************************************
00106 **************************************************/
00107 BOOL user_settings_parse_input_param( user_setting_data* p_data, int argc, char* argv[])
00108 {
00109         BOOL ret_val= TRUE;
00110         BOOL help_to_show= FALSE;
00111         BOOL some_error_to_ack= FALSE;
00112         int i;
00113         for( i= 1; i< argc; i++)
00114         {
00115                 if( !stricmp( argv[i], "-h"))
00116                 {
00117                         help_to_show= TRUE;
00118                 } 
00119                 else if( !strnicmp( argv[i], "-a", 2))
00120                 {
00121                         // The board's base address
00122                         if( !strnicmp( argv[i]+ 2, "0x", 2))
00123                         {
00124                                 // hex format
00125                                 int address= 0;
00126                                 sscanf( argv[i]+ 4, "%x", &address);
00127                                 p_data->m_base_address= (UINT16)address;
00128                         }
00129                         else
00130                         {
00131                                 // decimal format
00132                                 p_data->m_base_address= atoi( argv[i]+ 2);
00133                         }
00134                 }
00135                 else if( !strnicmp( argv[i], "-p", 2))
00136                 {
00137                         // parsed output filename
00138                         strcpy( p_data->m_parsed_output_filename, argv[i]+ 2);
00139                 }
00140                 else if( !strnicmp( argv[i], "-r", 2))
00141                 {
00142                         // raw output filename
00143                         strcpy( p_data->m_raw_output_filename, argv[i]+ 2);
00144                 }
00145                 else if( !strnicmp( argv[i], "-e", 2))
00146                 {
00147                         // Number of samples to acquire
00148                         p_data->m_num_events= atol( argv[i]+ 2);
00149                 }
00150                 else if( !strnicmp( argv[i], "-t", 2))
00151                 {
00152                         // Board type
00153                         if( !stricmp( argv[i]+ 2, "v1190a"))
00154                         {
00155                                 p_data->m_V1190_type= CVT_V1190_TYPE_A;
00156                                 p_data->m_tdc_count= CVT_V1190_NUM_TDC_A;
00157                         }
00158                         else if( !stricmp( argv[i]+ 2, "v1190b"))
00159                         {
00160                                 p_data->m_V1190_type= CVT_V1190_TYPE_B;
00161                                 p_data->m_tdc_count= CVT_V1190_NUM_TDC_B;
00162                         }
00163                         else if( !stricmp( argv[i]+ 2, "v1290a"))
00164                         {
00165                                 p_data->m_V1190_type= CVT_V1290_TYPE_A;
00166                                 p_data->m_tdc_count= CVT_V1290_NUM_TDC_A;
00167                         }
00168                         else if( !stricmp( argv[i]+ 2, "v1290n"))
00169                         {
00170                                 p_data->m_V1190_type= CVT_V1290_TYPE_N;
00171                                 p_data->m_tdc_count= CVT_V1290_NUM_TDC_N;
00172                         }
00173                         else
00174                         {
00175                                 // Bad parameter
00176                                 TRACE1("\nuser settings: bad V1190 type '%s'", argv[i]+ 2);
00177                                 TRACE("\n  restart with -h flag for help on usage\n");
00178                                 some_error_to_ack= TRUE;
00179                         }
00180                 }
00181                 else if( !strnicmp( argv[i], "-c", 2))
00182                 {
00183                         // continuous acquisition mode
00184                         if( !parse_continuous_param( argv[i]+ 2, &p_data->m_acquisition_mode.m_params.m_continuos))
00185                         {
00186                                 TRACE1("\nerror parsing continuous mode parameters '%s'\n", argv[i]+ 2);
00187                                 TRACE("\n  restart with -h flag for help on usage\n");
00188                                 some_error_to_ack= TRUE;
00189                         }
00190                         else
00191                         {
00192                                 p_data->m_acquisition_mode.m_mode= AM_CONTINUOUS;
00193                         }
00194                 }
00195                 else if( !strnicmp( argv[i], "-m", 2))
00196                 {
00197                         // trigger matching acquisition mode
00198                         if( !parse_trigger_matching_param( argv[i]+ 2, &p_data->m_acquisition_mode.m_params.m_trigger_matching))
00199                         {
00200                                 TRACE1("\nerror parsing trigger matching mode parameters '%s'\n", argv[i]+ 2);
00201                                 TRACE("\n  restart with -h flag for help on usage\n");
00202                                 some_error_to_ack= TRUE;
00203                         }
00204                         else
00205                         {
00206                                 p_data->m_acquisition_mode.m_mode= AM_TRIGGER_MATCH;
00207                         }
00208                 }
00209                 else
00210                 {
00211                         // Unknown parameter
00212                         TRACE1("\nuser settings: ignored command line parameter '%s'", argv[i]);
00213                         TRACE("\n  restart with -h flag for help on usage\n");
00214                         some_error_to_ack= TRUE;
00215                 }
00216         }
00217         if( some_error_to_ack)
00218         {
00219                 TRACE ( "Hit a key to continue ... \n");
00220                 while( !con_kbhit());
00221         }
00222         
00223         if( help_to_show|| some_error_to_ack)
00224         {
00225                 clrscr();
00226                 // show help screen
00227                 //       01234567890123456789012345678901234567890123456789012345678901234567890123456789
00228                 TRACE ( "\n");
00229                 TRACE ( "V1190Demo usage:    V1190Demo {params_list}\n");
00230                 TRACE ( "params_list:\n");
00231                 TRACE ( "-pfilename | -Pfilename\n");
00232                 TRACE ( "      filename= parsed output filename.\n");
00233                 TRACE1( "                If not specified '%s' will be assumed.\n", DEF_PARSED_OUTPUT_FILENAME);
00234                 TRACE ( "           example: V1190Demo -p\"parsed data out.dat\"\n");
00235                 TRACE ( "                    V1190Demo -Pparsed_data_out.dat\n");
00236                 TRACE ( "-rfilename | -Rfilename\n");
00237                 TRACE ( "      filename= raw output filename.\n");
00238                 TRACE1( "                If not specified '%s' will be assumed.\n", DEF_RAW_OUTPUT_FILENAME);
00239                 TRACE ( "           example: V1190Demo -r\"raw data out.dat\"\n");
00240                 TRACE ( "                    V1190Demo -Rraw_data_out.dat\n");
00241                 TRACE ( "-abase_address | -Abase_address\n");
00242                 TRACE ( "      base_address= the board's base address (16 bit MSW), expressed in decimal\n"); 
00243                 TRACE ( "                    or hexdecimal format. \n");
00244                 TRACE1( "                    If not specified '0x%04x' will be assumed.\n", DEF_BASE_ADDRESS);
00245                 TRACE ( "           example: V1190Demo -a4660\n");
00246                 TRACE ( "                    V1190Demo -A0x1234\n");
00247                 TRACE ( "-enum_events | -Enum_events\n");
00248                 TRACE ( "      num_events= number of events to acquire.\n");
00249                 TRACE1( "                  If not specified '%i' will be assumed.\n", DEF_NUM_EVENTS);
00250                 TRACE ( "                  A non positive number means don't care (i.e. acquire until key pressed)\n");
00251                 TRACE ( "           example: V1190Demo -e1024\n");
00252                 TRACE ( "                    V1190Demo -E32768\n");
00253                 
00254                 TRACE ( "Hit a key to continue ... \n");
00255                 while( !con_kbhit());
00256                 clrscr();
00257 
00258                 TRACE ( "-c\"params\" | -C\"params\"\n");
00259                 TRACE ( "      \"params\"= continuos acquisition mode parameters.\n");
00260                 TRACE1( "                  If not specified '%s' will be assumed.\n", DEF_ACQUISITION_MODE_PARAMS);
00261                 TRACE ( "           The parameter string format is: \n");
00262                 TRACE1( "                  \"edge_detection, m_res_width, enable_msk[0..%i] \n", MAX_V1190_TDC_COUNT-1);
00263                 TRACE ( "           where : \n");
00264                 TRACE ( "                  edge_detection  : The edge detection type numeric value\n");
00265                 TRACE ( "                                    (see CVT_V1190_EDGE_DETECTION_ENUM)\n");
00266                 TRACE ( "                  res_width       : The resolution width numeric value\n");
00267                 TRACE ( "                                    (see CVT_V1190_PAIR_RES_WIDTH_ENUM)\n");
00268                 TRACE1( "                  enable_msk[0..%i]       : The channel enable pattern buffer\n", MAX_CH_ENABLE_WORD- 1);
00269                 TRACE ( "                                            (hex or dec value). You must provide\n");
00270                 TRACE ( "                                            the number of required words depending on the board\n");
00271                 TRACE1( "                                            type (up to %i words). \n", MAX_CH_ENABLE_WORD);
00272                 TRACE ( "                                            If some words are missing, the corresponding channels will be disabled.\n");
00273                 TRACE ( "           example: V1190Demo -c\" 2, 0, 0xffff, 0xffff, 0xffff, 0xffff\"\n");
00274                 TRACE ( "-m\"params\" | -M\"params\"\n");
00275                 TRACE ( "      \"params\"= trigger matching mode parameters.\n");
00276                 TRACE ( "                  If not specified continuous acquisition mode will be assumed.\n");
00277                 TRACE ( "           The parameter string format is:\n");
00278                 TRACE1( "           \"header_trailer_enable, empty_event_enable, trigger_time_tag_enable, window_width, window_offset, extra_search_margin, reject_margin, edge_detection, m_res_width, enable_msk[0..%i] \n", MAX_V1190_TDC_COUNT- 1);
00279                 TRACE ( "           where : \n");
00280                 TRACE ( "                  header_trailer_enable  : Enable(1)/disable(0) header and\n");
00281                 TRACE ( "                                           trailer\n");
00282                 TRACE ( "                  empty_event_enable     : Enable(1)/disable(0) empty event\n");
00283                 TRACE ( "                                           storage\n");
00284                 TRACE ( "                  trigger_time_tag_enable: Enable(1)/disable(0) trigger time\n");
00285                 TRACE ( "                                           tag\n");
00286                 
00287                 TRACE ( "Hit a key to continue ... \n");
00288                 while( !con_kbhit());
00289                 clrscr();
00290 
00291                 TRACE ( "                  window_width           : Sets the width of the match window\n");
00292                 TRACE ( "                  window_offset          : Sets the offset of the match window\n");
00293                 TRACE ( "                                           with respect to the trigger itself\n");
00294                 TRACE ( "                  extra_search_margin    : Sets the extra search field of the\n");
00295                 TRACE ( "                                           match window\n");
00296                 TRACE ( "                  reject_margin          : Sets the reject margin, expressed in\n");
00297                 TRACE ( "                                           clock cycles\n");
00298                 TRACE ( "                  edge_detection         : The edge detection type numeric value\n");
00299                 TRACE ( "                                           (see CVT_V1190_EDGE_DETECTION_ENUM)\n");
00300                 TRACE ( "                  res_width              : The resolution width numeric value\n");
00301                 TRACE ( "                                           (see CVT_V1190_PAIR_RES_WIDTH_ENUM)\n");
00302                 TRACE1( "                  enable_msk[0..%i]       : The channel enable pattern buffer\n", MAX_CH_ENABLE_WORD- 1);
00303                 TRACE ( "                                            (hex or dec value). You must provide\n");
00304                 TRACE ( "                                            the number of required words depending on the board\n");
00305                 TRACE1( "                                            type (up to %i words). \n", MAX_CH_ENABLE_WORD);
00306                 TRACE ( "                                            If some words are missing, the corresponding channels will be disabled.\n");
00307                 TRACE ( "           example: V1190Demo -m\" 1, 1, 1, 200, 0, 0, 0, 2, 0, 0xffff, 0xffff, 0xffff, 0xffff\"\n");
00308                 TRACE ( "-tv1190_type | -Tv1190_type\n");
00309                 TRACE ( "      v1190_type= the V1190's type.\n");
00310                 TRACE ( "                  Valid values are: V1190A, V1190B, V1290A, V1290N\n");
00311                 TRACE1( "                    If not specified '%s' will be assumed.\n", DEF_BOARD_TYPE_STR);
00312                 TRACE ( "           example: V1190Demo -tV1190A\n");
00313                 TRACE ( "                    V1190Demo -TV1290N\n");
00314                 TRACE ( "-h | -H\n");
00315                 TRACE ( "      Show this help screen\n");
00316                 TRACE ( "           example: V1190Demo -h\n");
00317                 TRACE ( "\n");
00318                 TRACE ( "Hit a key to continue ... \n");
00319                 while( !con_kbhit());
00320                 
00321                 ret_val= FALSE;
00322         }
00323         return ret_val;
00324 }

00326 
00327 BOOL parse_continuous_param( const char* line, continuous_mode_param *target)
00328 {
00329         int i;
00330         const char* tok;
00331         char buff[ 300];
00332         
00333         strncpy( buff, line, 300);
00334 
00335         tok= strtok( buff, ", ");
00336         if( !tok)
00337                 return FALSE;
00338         target->m_edge_detection= atoi( tok);
00339 
00340         tok= strtok( NULL, ", ");
00341         if( !tok)
00342                 return FALSE;
00343         target->m_res_width= atoi( tok);
00344 
00345         memset( &target->m_enable_msk[ 0], 0, MAX_CH_ENABLE_WORD* sizeof( target->m_enable_msk[ 0]));
00346         for( i= 0; i< MAX_CH_ENABLE_WORD; i++)
00347         {
00348                 int tmp= 0;
00349                 tok= strtok( NULL, ", ");
00350                 if( !tok)
00351                         break;
00352                 if( !strnicmp( tok, "0x", 2))
00353                 {
00354                         // hex format
00355                         sscanf( tok+ 2, "%x", &tmp);
00356                 }
00357                 else
00358                 {
00359                         // decimal format
00360                         tmp= atoi( tok);
00361                 }
00362                 target->m_enable_msk[ i]= (UINT16)tmp;
00363         }
00364         return TRUE;
00365 }
00366 BOOL parse_trigger_matching_param( const char* line, trigger_matching_mode_param *target)
00367 {
00368         int i;
00369         const char* tok;
00370         char buff[ 300];
00371         
00372         strncpy( buff, line, 300);
00373 
00374         tok= strtok( buff, ", ");
00375         if( !tok)
00376                 return FALSE;
00377         target->m_header_trailer_enable= atoi( tok)? TRUE: FALSE;
00378 
00379         tok= strtok( NULL, ", ");
00380         if( !tok)
00381                 return FALSE;
00382         target->m_empty_event_enable= atoi( tok)? TRUE: FALSE;
00383 
00384         tok= strtok( NULL, ", ");
00385         if( !tok)
00386                 return FALSE;
00387         target->m_trigger_time_tag_enable= atoi( tok)? TRUE: FALSE;
00388 
00389         tok= strtok( NULL, ", ");
00390         if( !tok)
00391                 return FALSE;
00392         target->m_window_width= atoi( tok);
00393 
00394         tok= strtok( NULL, ", ");
00395         if( !tok)
00396                 return FALSE;
00397         target->m_window_offset= atoi( tok);
00398 
00399         tok= strtok( NULL, ", ");
00400         if( !tok)
00401                 return FALSE;
00402         target->m_extra_search_margin= atoi( tok);
00403 
00404         tok= strtok( NULL, ", ");
00405         if( !tok)
00406                 return FALSE;
00407         target->m_reject_margin= atoi( tok);
00408 
00409         tok= strtok( NULL, ", ");
00410         if( !tok)
00411                 return FALSE;
00412         target->m_edge_detection= atoi( tok);
00413 
00414         tok= strtok( NULL, ", ");
00415         if( !tok)
00416                 return FALSE;
00417         target->m_res_width= atoi( tok);
00418 
00419         memset( &target->m_enable_msk[ 0], 0, MAX_CH_ENABLE_WORD* sizeof( target->m_enable_msk[ 0]));
00420         for( i= 0; i< MAX_CH_ENABLE_WORD; i++)
00421         {
00422                 int tmp= 0;
00423                 tok= strtok( NULL, ", ");
00424                 if( !tok)
00425                         break;
00426                 if( !strnicmp( tok, "0x", 2))
00427                 {
00428                         // hex format
00429                         sscanf( tok+ 2, "%x", &tmp);
00430                 }
00431                 else
00432                 {
00433                         // decimal format
00434                         tmp= atoi( tok);
00435                 }
00436                 target->m_enable_msk[ i]= (UINT16)tmp;
00437         }
00438         return TRUE;
00439 }
